title: Swingers vs Hitters
description:
Riley takes a deep dive and reveals the differences between 'hitter' style patters versus 'swinger' style patterns using Victor Hovland and Jimmy Walker as examples of each. Obviously, both are great players, but if you know Riley well, you know he has a preference ;)

This was. a very enjoyable video to make and hopefully it provides more insight on how you can build concepts into your game that improve your ball striking. Please ask any questions in the comment section below. Looking forward to hearing from you!

#golfswing #golfcoach #victorhovland #jimmywalker #golfinstruction #coaching #golf #instructor

title: Elite Golf Online Live Q&A 10/24/25
How to Move Athletically in the Golf Swing
description:
We hear about this all the time... "Be athletic!" Well what does that ACTUALLY mean? And golf is littered with these kinds of sayings... "have better rhythm, just turn the wheel, move your weight forward, hit down on it, etc." The issue is, there are multiple ways to get that done. Even in this day of quantitative coaching, you still must have a way to qualify how you get to 'the number'.

In this video, Jackson and Riley explain a few techniques that can provide a better understanding of athletics in our game. Using a few principles from GOATA and David Weck, they break down the feet, legs, pelvis, spine, and ribs in order for viewers to understand concepts like early extension, shallowing, pressure shifts, and more.

Hold onto your seatbelts because, as usual, we're diving into the weeds in order to truly understand the golf swing and human movement!

#golfswing #golfcoach #golfinstruction

title: X Factor Golf Live Q&A 8/22/25
X Factor Golf Live Q&A 8/08/25
What Truly Shallows the Golf Club
description:
In this video, Riley Andrews covers the foundation of shallowing/slotting the golf club. Instead of artificially moving the club with the hands and the arms, study to the rib cage, the scapula, and the pelvis' active movement in order to check out lateral bend/side bend in the golf swing. The resulting movement and force direction that is applied to the club with blow your mind!!!

As always, please drop and comments/questions below. Riley and staff will respond to every question in order to help you better understand YOUR swing and how to get the most out of it!

Also, for really deep dives, check out our online academy, X Factor Golf, at www.xfactorgolf.com. Included in the online academy: over 400 categories and instructional videos on all areas of the golf swing, Masterclass video series, weekly 1 hour long q&a sessions where Riley answers individual questions, AND FREE CUSTOM SWING ANALYSES for each subscription.

Enjoy and Let's Hit Flushers! #shallowing #golfcoach #transition #golfcoach #golfinstruction

Hand Action in Golf Swing
description:
With the help of Hack Motion Golf, Riley describes the match ups that are needed in the hands to balance out two distinct types of movements in the body. At the end of the day it's all about balance outs so that your propensity to hit consistently solid and consistent shots elevates!

If you're interested in what Hack Motion has to offer, please feel free to visit their site www.hackmotion.com for more details.

Drop those questions/comments below so we can help you further with your game! 

Cheers, and hit some thumpers for us!

Elite Golf Schools

title: X Factor Golf Live Q&A 2/13/25
How the Spine Works in the Golf Swing
description: In this video, Riley breaks down the three main components to spine motion (lateral bend, flexion & extension, and rotation) and how to move the spine in a healthy and powerful manner. Obviously, spine health and health of movement is a hotly debated topic in our game. This video takes a look at this particular area and we define our ideas on healthy and effective movement. Ask any questions you may have and please subscribe to our channel to get the latest from Elite Golf Schools!

title: The Perfect Release
description:
Let's face it, there are a million and a half videos on how to release the golf club. This video is the outlier of all of those. In this video, Riley describes how to create a stable, strong, effortless, and precise release that will having you controlling the golf ball at the highest level. 

This video describes how and why various players on the PGA Tour and LIV Tours look different through the ball and the potential pros and cons of different movements during the swing.

Get ready to dive deep and thoroughly understand the entire downswing and release in the golf swing! Drop questions or comments below. It helps us better understand what we can help you with! Cheers!

title: Golf Impact Drills - This is a Game Changer!
description:
Golf Impact Drills - Game Changer!
In this video we go over some of our favorite golf impact drills. These game changing golf drills are sure to improve your impact position with your irons and driver. Doing slow motion golf impact drills will allow you to feel where you are in space and where the golf club is. In this impact video we go over how our chest is the engine to our golf swing, not our pelvis. Learning the difference between what our arms do and what our chest does can give you a clear path for understanding the golf swing and how different maps work together.  Rory Mcilroy's impact position and Victor Hovland's  are prime examples of what a great impact position looks like.

title: Golf Swing Different From a Baseball Swing?
description:
Golf Swing Different From a Baseball Swing?
What are the similarities? One of the main similarities we see between the golf swing and baseball swing is the internal and external rotation of the shoulders. This motion allows the club to shallow and enables you to rotate through the shot. This movement coupled with the drop of the pelvis can really make a huge difference in your ball striking.

Check out this video to get a basic understanding of how the body moves in the golf swing.
https://youtu.be/h1qP2Z2EDH4

title: DON’T Turn Your Shoulders in the Golf Swing! ❌
description:
In this Video, Riley and TJ dive deep into common misconceptions around the term “Shoulder Turn” in golf instruction.

When we are referring to shoulder turn, what we are really referring to is rotation of the spine. This in turn affects how we move the shoulders, but we can move those shoulders in more ways than you may think…

This leads to a fascinating discussion of how to control the instrument (golf club) with this shoulder turn. We hope you all enjoy!

title: Stop Hitting The Ground In Your Golf Swing
description:
Are you hitting the ground before the golf ball? In today’s video, TJ and Riley go over the  3 top golf tips people chunk the ball in golf.

Reason 1: improper weight shift in the pelvis
Reason 2: the golf club moving “over” the plane in transition
Reason 3: standing UP through impact.

title: This Golf Swing Mistake Can RUIN Your Game!
description:
In today’s session, we do some important MYTH BUSTING on some common mistakes we see in the golf swing. 

Namely, we’ve found that the Snead Drill, or the Basket Drill, has taught people to externally rotate the femurs, making the pelvis the active rotator. This generally leads to early rotation in the pelvis, causing the player to have to “save” it, in the downswing.

As we squat in transition, we want to keep the lead femur relatively internal, as opposed to external. This delays rotation until the right time, and smooths things out tremendously!

Check us out!

title: Driver vs. Wedge!
description:

In our system, there are many similarities, but also a few key differences in how energy gets released through the strike. Hope this helps everyone improve their golf swings 🙏

title: Global Golf Swing Principles
description:
We thought it best to take a step back from the “deep dive” into the weeds style format on specifics of the golf swing, and give you all something to work with in the golf swing from the bird’s eye view. If you’re trying to better your golf swing and are looking for a place to begin, this is the video for you.

https://elitegolfofaz.com/

#golf #golfswing #golflesson #pgatour

title: Stabilize the Club-Face to HIT MORE GREENS!
description:
Dive deep with us today as we understand all the different processes that help to stabilize the club face in the golf swing. From Hand action to body action, understanding these systems will help you gain consistency, and understand how players on the PGA Tour hit so many greens.

Work with us virtually! https://elitegolfofaz.com/online-lessons/

Come see us in person at our locations in AZ & CO!

CO: https://jakesacademy.com/

title: Own the Impact Zone in the Golf Swing
description:
Join us for an in depth dive into what it takes to master the impact phase in the golf swing.

We nerd out on pelvis/rib interaction, how to rotate the chest, and how to match up club, arm, and wrist structures appropriately to OWN the strike.

We hope this video helps you take your A-game to the golf course, and start feeling like an athlete. 🫡
